name: Bagon
bio:
Bagon is a solitary Pokémon that doesn’t form
groups with others of its kind. It also has a head
hard enough to cleave a boulder in one strike.

name: Bombirdier
bio: Bombirdier uses the apron on its chest to bundle up food, which it carries back to its nest. It enjoys dropping things that make loud noises.

name: Passimian
bio:
Passimian live in groups of about 20, with
each member performing an assigned role.
Through cooperation, the group survives.

name: Bibarel
bio:
Bibarel fur repels water and is also a fantastic material for heat
retention. These Pokémon create dams on rivers to live in.

name: Poipole
bio:
An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it
cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with
poison from the needles on its head.

name: Exeggutor
bio:
When they work together, Exeggutor’s three
heads can put out powerful psychic energy.
Cloudy days make this Pokémon sluggish.

name: Seaking
bio:
Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed
boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from
washing away.

name: Pikachu
bio:
Possesses cheek sacs in which it stores electricity. This clever
forest-dweller roasts tough berries with an electric shock before
consuming them.

name: Skwovet
bio:
It eats berries nonstop—a habit that has made
it more resilient than it looks. It’ll show up on
farms, searching for yet more berries.

name: Brionne
bio:
On nights when the sea is calm, Brionne dance
with one another to the singing of the Primarina
that’s leading them.

name: Articuno
bio:
This Pokémon can control ice at will. Articuno
is said to live in snowy mountains riddled
with permafrost.

name: Bellsprout
bio:
Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares
tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.

name: Rockruff
bio:
This Pokémon intimidates opponents by striking
the ground with the rocks on its neck. The
moment an opponent flinches, Rockruff attacks.

name: Clobbopus
bio:
Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isn’t alarmed
when that happens—it knows they’ll grow back.
It’s about as smart as a three-year-old.

name: Sudowoodo
bio:
Though it pretends to be a tree, it fails to fool even children.
To the touch, its body feels more like rock than tree bark.
Sudowoodo's extreme aversion to water merits special note.

name: Ledian
bio:
It flies through the night sky, sprinkling sparkly
dust. According to some, if that dust sticks to
you, good things will happen to you.

name: Vanillite
bio:
Supposedly, this Pokémon was born from an
icicle. It spews out freezing air at −58 degrees
Fahrenheit to make itself more comfortable.

name: Chimecho
bio:
Can emit waves of air powerful enough to knock out prey taller
than itself. I hypothesize that it amplifies the faint sound of wind
within its body.

name: Diggersby
bio:
The fur on its belly retains heat exceptionally
well. People used to make heavy winter clothing
from fur shed by this Pokémon.

name: Smoliv
bio: This Pokémon converts nutrients into oil, which it stores in the fruit on its head. It can easily go a whole week without eating or drinking.

name: Cottonee
bio:
Weaving together the cotton of both Cottonee
and Eldegoss produces exquisite cloth that’s
highly prized by many luxury brands.

name: Seel
bio:
Loves freezing-cold conditions.
Relishes swimming in a frigid climate
of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Dialga
bio:
This Pokémon is revered as a deity in Hisuian legend. The birth
of Dialga was what caused the vast river of time to begin
flowing in our world.

name: Corsola
bio:
These Pokémon live in warm seas.
In prehistoric times, many lived in the
oceans around the Galar region as well.

name: Eelektrik
bio:
These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they
spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it
with electricity.

name: Ralts
bio:
Tends to prefer people with a chipper disposition to those who
are gloomy, but it has shown no discrimination with regard to
age or gender. Needs more research.

name: Zapdos
bio:
Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon. It’s said
that when Zapdos rubs its feathers together,
lightning will fall immediately after.

name: Grapploct
bio:
Searching for an opponent to test its skills
against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle
is over, it returns to the sea.

name: Kommo-o
bio:
Certain ruins have paintings of ancient warriors
wearing armor made of Kommo-o scales.

name: Pyroar
bio:
The temperature of its breath is over 10,000
degrees Fahrenheit, but Pyroar doesn’t use it on
its prey. This Pokémon prefers to eat raw meat.

name: Marshtomp
bio:
Marshtomp is much faster at traveling through mud than it is at
swimming. This Pokémon’s hindquarters exhibit obvious
development, giving it the ability to walk on just its hind legs.

name: Druddigon
bio:
Druddigon are vicious and cunning. They take up
residence in nests dug out by other Pokémon,
treating the stolen nests as their own lairs.

name: Helioptile
bio:
The sun powers this Pokémon’s electricity
generation. Interruption of that process
stresses Helioptile to the point of weakness.

name: Flittle
bio: It spends its time running around wastelands. If anyone steals its beloved berries, it will chase them down and exact its revenge.

name: Delibird
bio:
It has a generous habit of sharing its food with
people and Pokémon, so it’s always scrounging
around for more food.

name: Muk
bio:
Smells so awful, it can cause fainting.
Through degeneration of its nose,
it lost its sense of smell.

name: Groudon
bio:
Through Primal Reversion and with nature’s full power,
it will take back its true form. It can cause magma to
erupt and expand the landmass of the world.

name: Porygon
bio:
It has no discernible heartbeat and does not seem to draw
breath, and yet it appears to function without issue. I cannot
even begin to explain this utterly bizarre anomaly.

name: Conkeldurr
bio:
When going all out, this Pokémon throws aside
its concrete pillars and leaps at opponents to
pummel them with its fists.

name: Mr. Rime
bio:
Its amusing movements make it very popular.
It releases its psychic power from the pattern
on its belly.

name: Wailord
bio:
Its immense size is the reason for its popularity.
Wailord watching is a favorite sightseeing
activity in various parts of the world.

name: Beedrill
bio:
It has three poisonous stingers on its
forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab
its enemy repeatedly.

name: Infernape
bio:
A tall, hardy Pokémon with a dazzling appearance. It shrouds
itself in flame and battles as if engaged in dance—truly a sight
to behold.

name: Frillish
bio:
Legend has it that the residents of a sunken
ancient city changed into these Pokémon.

name: Riolu
bio:
Though infantile in appearance, it has the mysterious ability to
read the minds of humans. The pure of heart are met with
Riolu's approval, while those of ill nature earn only its loathing.

name: Rhydon
bio:
Rapidly rotates its horn to bore through bedrock. It swaggers
around volcanic regions, protected from the lava's heat by its
tough, armorlike hide.

name: Fuecoco
bio: Its flame sac is small, so energy is always leaking out. This energy is released from the dent atop Fuecoco’s head and flickers to and fro.

name: Klang
bio:
Many companies in the Galar region choose
Klang as their logo. This Pokémon is considered
the symbol of industrial technology.

name: Braixen
bio:
When the twig is plucked from its tail,
friction sets the twig alight. The flame
is used to send signals to its allies.

name: Fidough
bio: The yeast in Fidough’s breath is useful for cooking, so this Pokémon has been protected by people since long ago.

name: Spearow
bio:
Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around
very fast to protect its territory.

name: Froslass
bio:
A Pokémon inhabited by the soul of a woman who died bearing
a grudge in the snowy mountains. Legends of Froslass placing
deathly curses on misbehaving men send shivers down my spine.

name: Whimsicott
bio:
As long as this Pokémon bathes in sunlight, its
cotton keeps growing. If too much cotton fluff
builds up, Whimsicott tears it off and scatters it.

name: Cobalion
bio:
From the moment it’s born, this Pokémon
radiates the air of a leader. Its presence will
calm even vicious foes.

name: Melmetal
bio:
Centrifugal force is behind the punches of
Melmetal’s heavy hex-nut arms. Melmetal is said
to deliver the strongest punches of all Pokémon.

name: Kabutops
bio:
The cause behind the extinction of this species is
unknown. Kabutops were aggressive Pokémon
that inhabited warm seas.

name: Pachirisu
bio:
A species related to the Pikachu line. Though Pachirisu is a calm
Pokémon, it still presents a danger should one touch its
electrified tail or cheeks.

name: Psyduck
bio:
Suffers perpetual headaches. If the agony grows too great,
Psyduck's latent power erupts, contrary to Psyduck's intent.
Ergo, I am exploring ways to ease the pain.

name: Palafin
bio: Its physical capabilities are no different than a Finizen’s, but when its allies are in danger, it transforms and powers itself up.

name: Dachsbun
bio: The surface of this Pokémon’s skin hardens when exposed to intense heat, and its body has an appetizing aroma.

name: Chinchou
bio:
On the dark ocean floor, its only means of
communication is its constantly flashing lights.

name: Buzzwole
bio:
Buzzwole goes around showing off its
abnormally swollen muscles. It is one kind
of Ultra Beast.

name: Meganium
bio:
The fragrance of Meganium’s flower soothes and calms
emotions. In battle, this Pokémon gives off more of its
becalming scent to blunt the foe’s fighting spirit.

name: Corvisquire
bio:
The lessons of many harsh battles have taught it
how to accurately judge an opponent’s strength.

name: Greninja
bio:
It appears and vanishes with a ninja’s grace.
It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while
slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.

name: Cinderace
bio:
It’s skilled at both offense and defense, and it
gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts
showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.

name: Espathra
bio: It emits psychic power from the gaps between its multicolored frills and sprints at speeds greater than 120 mph.

name: Gorebyss
bio:
It sucks bodily fluids out of its prey. The
leftover meat sinks to the seafloor, where it
becomes food for other Pokémon.

name: Cubone
bio:
This Pokémon wears the skull of its deceased
mother. Sometimes Cubone’s dreams make it cry,
but each tear Cubone sheds makes it stronger.

name: Toedscruel
bio: It coils its 10 tentacles around prey and sucks out their nutrients, causing the prey pain. The folds along the rim of its head are a popular delicacy.

name: Fletchling
bio:
When this Pokémon gets excited, its body
temperature increases sharply. If you touch a
Fletchling with bare hands, you might get burned.

name: Espeon
bio:
Wields an arcane power with which it can predict the weather
and even people's thoughts. When bathed in sunshine, the
scarlet orb on its brow glows and builds energy.

name: Naclstack
bio: It compresses rock salt inside its body and shoots out hardened salt pellets with enough force to perforate an iron sheet.

name: Houndour
bio:
They make repeated eerie howls before dawn
to call attention to their pack.

name: Volcarona
bio:
This Pokémon emerges from a cocoon formed of
raging flames. Ancient murals depict Volcarona as
a deity of fire.

name: Varoom
bio: The steel section is Varoom’s actual body. This Pokémon clings to rocks and converts the minerals within into energy to fuel its activities.

name: Regirock
bio:
Cutting-edge technology was used to study
the internals of this Pokémon’s rock body, but
nothing was found—not even a brain or a heart.

name: Lucario
bio:
A most gallant-looking creature. It emits energy waves and
controls them with precision, using them to sense even faraway
beings. I have given the name ”aura” to this power.

name: Zebstrika
bio:
They have lightning-like movements.
When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of
thunder reverberates.

name: Kingdra
bio:
Scales shed by this Pokémon have such a
splendorous gleam to them that they’ve been
given to royalty as gifts.

name: Cofagrigus
bio:
There are many depictions of Cofagrigus
decorating ancient tombs. They’re symbols
of the wealth that kings of bygone eras had.

name: Gossifleur
bio:
It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous
song. This delightful display has charmed many
into raising this Pokémon.

name: Kleavor
bio:
A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes
and shields itself with hard stone. If one should chance upon
this Pokémon in the wilds, one's only recourse is to flee.

name: Roselia
bio:
Though beautiful, it has highly poisonous thorns. There is an old
tradition in my homeland wherein one would send these thorns
to an opponent to challenge them to a duel.

name: Finizen
bio: Its water ring is made from seawater mixed with a sticky fluid that Finizen secretes from its blowhole.

name: Dubwool
bio:
Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the
opposite gender. They never see use in battle.

name: Azumarill
bio:
These Pokémon create air-filled bubbles. When
Azurill play in rivers, Azumarill will cover them
with these bubbles.

name: Cetoddle
bio: It lives in frigid regions in pods of five or so individuals. It loves the minerals found in snow and ice.

name: Oranguru
bio:
It knows the forest inside and out. If it comes
across a wounded Pokémon, Oranguru will
gather medicinal herbs to treat it.

name: Floragato
bio: The hardness of Floragato’s fur depends on the Pokémon’s mood. When Floragato is prepared to battle, its fur becomes pointed and needle sharp.

name: Sandygast
bio:
Sandygast mainly inhabits beaches. It takes
control of anyone who puts their hand into its
mouth, forcing them to make its body bigger.

name: Nidorino
bio:
It’s nervous and quick to act aggressively.
The potency of its poison increases along with
the level of adrenaline present in its body.

name: Staryu
bio:
Fish Pokémon nibble at it, but Staryu isn’t
bothered. Its body regenerates quickly, even
if part of it is completely torn off.

name: Monferno
bio:
The deeper the blue on its face, the more powerful it will grow
to become. It leaps about every which way and lands powerful
blows against its opponents with the flame on its tail.

name: Ampharos
bio:
Its tail shines bright and strong. It has been
prized since long ago as a beacon for sailors.

name: Iron Hands
bio: This Pokémon shares many similarities with Iron Hands, an object mentioned in a certain expedition journal.

name: Bonsly
bio:
Its tears elicit sympathy from those who see them, but do
not be deceived! This expulsion of body water is merely a
physiological mechanism for keeping itself in good health.

name: Shaymin
bio:
When the turning of seasons brings the cruel winter to its end
and the joyous people give thanks to the heavens, Shaymin
appears and covers the withered land with flowers.

name: Tinkatink
bio: This Pokémon pounds iron scraps together to make a hammer. It will remake the hammer again and again until it’s satisfied with the result.

name: Weezing
bio:
It can’t suck in air quite as well as a Galarian
Weezing, but the toxins it creates are more
potent than those of its counterpart.

name: Meditite
bio:
Meditite heightens its inner energy through meditation.
It survives on just one berry a day. Minimal eating is another
aspect of this Pokémon’s training.

name: Salandit
bio:
This sneaky Pokémon will slink behind its prey
and immobilize it with poisonous gas before the
prey even realizes Salandit is there.

name: Scorbunny
bio:
It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and
one on its nose. Once it’s raring to fight, these
pads radiate tremendous heat.

name: Drampa
bio:
Drampa is a kind and friendly Pokémon—up until
it’s angered. When that happens, it stirs up a
gale and flattens everything around.

name: Finneon
bio:
What a gorgeous sight this Pokémon is as it swims with its long,
pink-painted caudal fins fluttering behind it. Finneon's beautiful
appearance has led to its nickname: ”finery fish.”

name: Simisear
bio:
When it gets excited, embers rise from its head
and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it
loves sweets.

name: Gourgeist
bio:
In the darkness of a new-moon night, Gourgeist
will come knocking. Whoever answers the door
will be swept off to the afterlife.

name: Urshifu
bio:
Inhabiting the mountains of a distant region, this
Pokémon races across sheer cliffs, training its legs
and refining its moves.

name: Tadbulb
bio: It floats using the electricity stored in its body. When thunderclouds are around, Tadbulb will float higher off the ground.

name: Tranquill
bio:
These bright Pokémon have acute memories.
Apparently delivery workers often choose them
as their partners.

name: Huntail
bio:
Deep seas are their habitat. According to
tradition, when Huntail wash up onshore,
something unfortunate will happen.

name: Shelmet
bio:
It has a strange physiology that responds to
electricity. When together with Karrablast,
Shelmet evolves for some reason.

name: Solosis
bio:
Many say that the special liquid covering this
Pokémon’s body would allow it to survive in
the vacuum of space.

name: Heatmor
bio:
A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the
hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour
their insides.

name: Tatsugiri
bio: Tatsugiri is an extremely cunning Pokémon. It feigns weakness to lure in prey, then orders its partner to attack.

name: Mudbray
bio:
It eats dirt to create mud and smears this mud all
over its feet, giving them the grip needed to walk
on rough terrain without slipping.

name: Cresselia
bio:
Cresselia is reminiscent of the crescent moon. It leaves a brilliant
line of light in its wake as it flies across the night sky. I daresay
it resembles the heavenly maiden who created the Milky Way.

name: Petilil
bio:
The leaves on its head are highly valued for medicinal purposes.
Dry the leaves in the sun, boil them, and then drink the bitter
decoction for remarkably effective relief from fatigue.

name: Blitzle
bio:
Its mane shines when it discharges electricity.
They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes
to communicate.

name: Palpitoad
bio:
On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to
the ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their
bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.

name: Surskit
bio:
It lives in ponds and marshes that feature lots
of plant life. It often fights with Dewpider,
whose habitat and diet are similar.

name: Drapion
bio:
Has a brutish, ferocious temperament. With immense strength
and a sturdy shell off which swords will bounce, it rampages
about and wreaks havoc.

name: Virizion
bio:
It darts around opponents with a flurry of quick
movements, slicing them up with its horns.

name: Doublade
bio:
The two swords employ a strategy of rapidly
alternating between offense and defense to
bring down their prey.

name: Lombre
bio:
It lives at the water’s edge where it is sunny.
It sleeps on a bed of water grass by day and
becomes active at night.

name: Slakoth
bio:
Slakoth’s heart beats just once a minute. Whatever happens,
it is content to loaf around motionless. It is rare to see this
Pokémon in motion.

name: Chesnaught
bio:
When it takes a defensive posture with its fists
guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.

name: Venomoth
bio:
The powdery scales on its wings are hard to
remove from skin. They also contain poison
that leaks out on contact.

name: Chingling
bio:
This Pokémon gave me an excruciating headache when it
seemingly cried out without making a sound. Perhaps there are
some sounds that the human ear is simply incapable of hearing.

name: Pidgeotto
bio:
This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies
around its large territory in search of prey.

name: Galvantula
bio:
It lays traps of electrified threads near the nests
of bird Pokémon, aiming to snare chicks that are
not yet good at flying.

name: Starmie
bio:
Starmie swims by spinning its body at high speed.
As this Pokémon cruises through the ocean, it
absorbs tiny plankton.

name: Xatu
bio:
This odd Pokémon can see both the past and
the future. It eyes the sun’s movement all day.

name: Iron Crown
bio: There was supposedly an incident in which it launched shining blades to cut everything around it to pieces. Little else is known about it.

name: Trapinch
bio:
It makes an inescapable conical pit and lies in
wait at the bottom for prey to come
tumbling down.

name: Gallade
bio:
The blades extending from its elbows are sharper than the
finest swords. Its swordsmanship, albeit self-taught, is
astonishingly impressive.

name: Azurill
bio:
Although Azurill are normally docile, an angry
one will swing around the big ball on its tail and
try to smash its opponents.

name: Shellos
bio:
Found in abundance on seashores bordering warm waters.
Shellos are unexpectedly friendly and will crawl toward any
person they see. Take care not to get coated in mucus!

name: Chi-Yu
bio: The envy accumulated within curved beads that sparked multiple conflicts has clad itself in fire and become a Pokémon.

name: Duosion
bio:
Its brain has split into two, and the two
halves rarely think alike. Its actions are
utterly unpredictable.

name: Clefable
bio:
Legend says that on clear, quiet nights, it listens for the voices
of its kin living on the moon. I, too, often think of my homeland,
so far away.

name: Probopass
bio:
It is able to emit powerful magnetism, allowing it control over
the iron sand that forms its luscious mustache. Using this iron
sand, Probopass forms hard stones with which it smites its prey.

name: Skrelp
bio:
Skrelp looks like a piece of rotten seaweed, so it
can blend in with seaweed drifting on the ocean
and avoid being detected by enemies.

name: Igglybuff
bio:
Taking advantage of the softness of its body,
Igglybuff moves as if bouncing. Its body turns a
deep pink when its temperature rises.

name: Nosepass
bio:
Once the people of Hisui discovered that its red nose always
points north, they grew to rely on it greatly when traveling afar.
The nose seems to work in a similar way to ancient compasses.

name: Cramorant
bio:
This hungry Pokémon swallows Arrokuda whole.
Occasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to
swallow a Pokémon other than its preferred prey.

name: Arbok
bio:
The frightening patterns on its belly have been
studied. Six variations have been confirmed.

name: Chespin
bio:
Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back
that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn’t faze it.

name: Simipour
bio:
It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs
low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with
its tail.

name: Pidgeot
bio:
This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed,
seeking prey. Its large talons are feared
as wicked weapons.

name: Beautifly
bio:
A colorful and incredibly beautiful but also greedy Pokémon.
In an effort to keep its favorite food all to itself, it will chase
away Combee as they try to gather nectar.

name: Garchomp
bio:
Soars across the heavens at blinding speed—a magnificent sight!
It has a feral disposition. Utmost caution is required if one
meets a Garchomp out in the wilds.

name: Yungoos
bio:
Although it will eat anything, it prefers fresh
living things, so it marches down streets
in search of prey.

name: Vullaby
bio:
Vullaby grow quickly. Bones that have gotten too
small for older Vullaby to wear often get passed
down to younger ones in the nest.

name: Araquanid
bio:
It acts as a caretaker for Dewpider, putting them
inside its bubble and letting them eat any
leftover food.

name: Primeape
bio:
It stops being angry only when nobody else
is around. To view this moment is very difficult.

name: Cutiefly
bio:
An opponent’s aura can tell Cutiefly what that
opponent’s next move will be. Then Cutiefly can
glide around the attack and strike back.

name: Spidops
bio: Spidops covers its territory in tough, sticky threads to set up traps for intruders.

name: Cradily
bio:
Once Cradily catches prey in its tentacles,
it digests them whole and absorbs their nutrients.

name: Baxcalibur
bio: It launches itself into battle by flipping upside down and spewing frigid air from its mouth. It finishes opponents off with its dorsal blade.

name: Bellibolt
bio: What appear to be eyeballs are actually organs for discharging the electricity generated by Bellibolt’s belly-button dynamo.

name: Quilladin
bio:
They strengthen their lower bodies by
running into one another. They are very
kind and won’t start fights.

name: Pyukumuku
bio:
It’s covered in a slime that keeps its skin moist,
allowing it to stay on land for days without
drying up.

name: Grotle
bio:
Appears where there is clean spring water. The fruit that grows
on the shrubs on its shell is sweet, nutritious, and truly delicious.

name: Great Tusk
bio: This creature resembles a mysterious Pokémon that, according to a paranormal magazine, has lived since ancient times.

name: Deerling
bio:
The turning of the seasons changes the color and
scent of this Pokémon’s fur. People use it to mark
the seasons.

name: Sneasler
bio:
Because of Sneasler's virulent poison and daunting physical
prowess, no other species could hope to best it on the frozen
highlands. Preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.

name: Tinkaton
bio: The hammer tops 220 pounds, yet it gets swung around easily by Tinkaton as it steals whatever it pleases and carries its plunder back home.

name: Centiskorch
bio:
While its burning body is already dangerous on
its own, this excessively hostile Pokémon also has
large and very sharp fangs.

name: Graveler
bio:
Dwells in holes dug into sheer walls of stone. It enjoys rolling
down slopes as though it were a boulder during a rockfall,
so keep an eye upward while traversing mountain roads.

name: Terrakion
bio:
In Unovan legend, Terrakion battled against
humans in an effort to protect other Pokémon.

name: Sneasel
bio:
Its sturdy, curved claws are ideal for traversing precipitous cliffs.
From the tips of these claws drips a venom that infiltrates the
nerves of any prey caught in Sneasel's grasp.

name: Dipplin
bio: The head sticking out belongs to the fore-wyrm, while the tail belongs to the core-wyrm. The two share one apple and help each other out.

name: Dewott
bio:
Its exquisite double-scalchop technique is likely the result of
daily training, and it can send even masters of the blade fleeing
in defeat.

name: Arceus
bio:
It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines
across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon.
Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

name: Stoutland
bio:
Stoutland is immensely proud of its impressive
moustache. It’s said that moustache length is what
determines social standing among this species.

name: Togepi
bio:
This ovate creature is frequently mistaken for a moving egg
when encountered out in the fields or in the mountains.
Its guileless smile soothes the soul.

name: Metapod
bio:
Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell,
the body inside is tender. It can’t withstand a
harsh attack.

name: Sewaddle
bio:
Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of
leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.

name: Skeledirge
bio: Skeledirge’s gentle singing soothes the souls of all that hear it. It burns its enemies to a crisp with flames of over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Slowpoke
bio:
When this Pokémon’s tail is soaked in water,
sweetness seeps from it. Slowpoke uses this trait
to lure in and fish up other Pokémon.

name: Sigilyph
bio:
A discovery was made in the desert where
Sigilyph fly. The ruins of what may have been
an ancient city were found beneath the sands.

name: Seadra
bio:
Seadra’s mouth is slender, but its suction power
is strong. In an instant, Seadra can suck in food
that’s larger than the opening of its mouth.

name: Nacli
bio: The ground scrapes its body as it travels, causing it to leave salt behind. Salt is constantly being created and replenished inside Nacli’s body.

name: Mime Jr.
bio:
Known to turn up in bustling marketplaces now and again.
It mimics people much as a child would, then watches how they
react, eyes sparkling.

name: Staravia
bio:
They form remarkably large flocks and are constantly fighting
amongst themselves. I suspect that those with magnificent
plumes on their heads are the strong ones.

name: Ariados
bio:
It spews threads from its mouth to catch its
prey. When night falls, it leaves its web to go
hunt aggressively.

name: Thwackey
bio:
When it’s drumming out rapid beats in battle, it
gets so caught up in the rhythm that it won’t even
notice that it’s already knocked out its opponent.

name: Persian
bio:
Its elegant and refined behavior clashes with that
of the barbaric Perrserker. The relationship
between the two is one of mutual disdain.

name: Lileep
bio:
Lileep clings to rocks on the seabed. When prey
comes close, this Pokémon entangles it with
petallike tentacles.

name: Whiscash
bio:
Strikes its caudal fin against the swamp bed to shake the ground
and startle its prey. It will then swallow the fleeing prey whole.
People mistook this behavior as the cause of earthquakes.

name: Cetitan
bio: Ice energy builds up in the horn on its upper jaw, causing the horn to reach cryogenic temperatures that freeze its surroundings.

name: Giratina
bio:
There is one Hisuian verse that tells of a powerful light creating
a deep shadow. I imagine that this deep shadow is Giratina.

name: Poliwhirl
bio:
This Pokémon’s sweat is a slimy mucus. When
captured, Poliwhirl can slither from its enemies’
grasp and escape.

name: Cryogonal
bio:
When the weather gets hot, these Pokémon turn
into water vapor. Cryogonal are almost never
seen during summer.

name: Wingull
bio:
It soars on updrafts without flapping its wings.
It makes a nest on sheer cliffs at the sea’s edge.

name: Mothim
bio:
Scatters steel-colored scales as it flaps its wings. Despite
being observed feeding primarily on the nectar of flowers,
Mothim is not often seen around flower gardens.

name: Quaquaval
bio: Dancing in ways that evoke far-away places, this Pokémon mesmerizes all that see it. Flourishes of its decorative water feathers slice into its foes.

name: Tyrantrum
bio:
A single bite of Tyrantrum’s massive jaws will
demolish a car. This Pokémon was the king of the
ancient world.

name: Nuzleaf
bio:
They live in holes bored in large trees. The sound
of Nuzleaf’s grass flute fills listeners with dread.

name: Gogoat
bio:
They inhabit mountainous regions.
The leader of the herd is decided by
a battle of clashing horns.

name: Steenee
bio:
Any Corvisquire that pecks at this
Pokémon will be greeted with a smack from
its sepals followed by a sharp kick.

name: Masquerain
bio:
Its thin, winglike antennae are highly absorbent.
It waits out rainy days in tree hollows.

name: Paras
bio:
Sometimes seen at the foot of trees in humid forests.
The mushrooms on its back—called tochukaso—are not present
on infant specimens and instead emerge as Paras matures.

name: Arctovish
bio:
The skin on its face is impervious to attack, but
breathing difficulties made this Pokémon go
extinct anyway.

name: Aurorus
bio:
When gripped by rage, Aurorus will emanate
freezing air, covering everything around it in ice.

name: Nidoqueen
bio:
It pacifies offspring by placing them in the gaps
between the spines on its back. The spines will
never secrete poison while young are present.

name: Karrablast
bio:
It spits a liquid from its mouth to melt through
Shelmet’s shell. Karrablast doesn’t eat the shell—
it eats only the contents.

name: Wugtrio
bio: A variety of fish Pokémon, Wugtrio was once considered to be a regional form of Dugtrio.

name: Loudred
bio:
The force of this Pokémon’s loud voice isn’t just
the sound—it’s also the wave of air pressure that
blows opponents away and damages them.

name: Roserade
bio:
Hidden within the bouquet on each hand are thorned whips
loaded with virulent poison. Roserade moves gracefully as it
corners its prey and mercilessly lashes them with its whips.

name: Plusle
bio:
When Plusle is cheering on its partner, it flashes with electric
sparks from all over its body. If its partner loses, this Pokémon
cries loudly.

name: Floatzel
bio:
Has a long, rather splendid flotation sac, which prevents
Floatzel from drowning even in stormy seas. One might glimpse
this species around fishing hamlets from time to time.

name: Noctowl
bio:
When it needs to think, it rotates its head
180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.

name: Brute Bonnet
bio: It bears a slight resemblance to a Pokémon described in a dubious magazine as a cross between a dinosaur and a mushroom.

name: Cloyster
bio:
Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to
open, even by those with superior strength.

name: Zarude
bio:
Once the vines on Zarude’s body tear off, they
become nutrients in the soil. This helps the plants
of the forest grow.

name: Snorlax
bio:
This glutton appears in villages without warning and devours the
entirety of their rice granaries—such occurrences have long been
counted among the gravest of disasters.

name: Solgaleo
bio:
Solgaleo was once known as the Beast That
Devours the Sun. Energy in the form of light
radiates boundlessly from it.

name: Pineco
bio:
It sticks tree bark to itself with its saliva,
making itself thicker and larger. Elderly Pineco
are ridiculously huge.

name: Grubbin
bio:
It uses its big jaws to dig nests into the forest
floor, and it loves to feed on sweet tree sap.

name: Prinplup
bio:
It swims gracefully through the frigid sea and sings with a voice
like the roaring tide. It has powerful, sturdy wings and dignity
to match.

name: Clauncher
bio:
By detonating gas that accumulates in its right
claw, this Pokémon launches water like a bullet.
This is how Clauncher defeats its enemies.

name: Armarouge
bio: This Pokémon clads itself in armor that has been fortified by psychic and fire energy, and it shoots blazing fireballs.

name: Wattrel
bio: These Pokémon make their nests on coastal cliffs. The nests have a strange, crackling texture, and they’re a popular delicacy.

name: Thundurus
bio:
They say this wielder of electricity has waged war with its
nemesis, Tornadus, since time immemorial. The lightning bolts
it hurls pierce the very earth and enrich the soil.

name: Mudkip
bio:
In water, Mudkip breathes using the gills on its cheeks. If it is
faced with a tight situation in battle, this Pokémon will unleash
its amazing power—it can crush rocks bigger than itself.

name: Shroodle
bio: To keep enemies away from its territory, it paints markings around its nest using a poisonous liquid that has an acrid odor.

name: Komala
bio:
It remains asleep from birth to death as a result
of the sedative properties of the leaves that
form its diet.

name: Pawniard
bio:
A pack of these Pokémon forms to serve a
Bisharp boss. Each Pawniard trains diligently,
dreaming of one day taking the lead.

name: Starly
bio:
They live in the fields and mountains, gathering in large flocks.
Their cries are quite obnoxious. Though small, their wings are
strong—a strike from them leaves pain that persists for a week.

name: Perrserker
bio:
After many battles, it evolved dangerous
claws that come together to form daggers
when extended.

name: Hariyama
bio:
Hariyama that are big and fat aren’t necessarily
strong. There are some small ones that move
nimbly and use moves skillfully.

name: Alomomola
bio:
The reason it helps Pokémon in a weakened
condition is that any Pokémon coming after
them may also attack Alomomola.

name: Rufflet
bio:
Its chick-like looks belie its hotheadedness. It challenges its
parents at every opportunity, desperate to prove its strength.

name: Sinistcha
bio: It prefers cool, dark places, such as the back of a shelf or the space beneath a home's floorboards. It wanders in search of prey after sunset.

name: Glameow
bio:
Bewitches humans with its helical tail and piercing gaze.
Its hidden claws are quite sharp as well, making this Pokémon
an exceedingly tricky opponent if antagonized.

name: Onix
bio:
This chain of immense stones resembles a giant serpent. Tremors
shake the earth above as it burrows deep beneath the ground,
feeding on boulders as it goes.

name: Sealeo
bio:
Its white whiskers are very sensitive. Sealeo will balance Spheal
on the tip of its nose, checking its scent and its feel to be sure
the Spheal is healthy.

name: Exeggcute
bio:
These Pokémon get nervous when they’re not in a
group of six. The minute even one member of the
group goes missing, Exeggcute become cowardly.

name: Diancie
bio:
It can instantly create many diamonds
by compressing the carbon in the air
between its hands.

name: Jumpluff
bio:
Jumpluff rides warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to
foreign lands. The Pokémon descends to the ground when it
encounters cold air while it is floating.

name: Miraidon
bio: This seems to be the Iron Serpent mentioned in an old book. The Iron Serpent is said to have turned the land to ash with its lightning.

name: Stakataka
bio:
When stone walls started moving and attacking,
the brute’s true identity was this mysterious
life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.

name: Weepinbell
bio:
When hungry, it swallows anything that moves.
Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.

name: Glastrier
bio:
Glastrier has tremendous physical strength, and
the mask of ice covering its face is 100 times
harder than diamond.

name: Nickit
bio:
Cunning and cautious, this Pokémon survives by
stealing food from others. It erases its tracks with
swipes of its tail as it makes off with its plunder.

name: Quagsire
bio:
Its body is always slimy. It often bangs its head
on the river bottom as it swims but seems not
to care.

name: Snom
bio:
It eats snow that piles up on the ground.
The more snow it eats, the bigger and more
impressive the spikes on its back grow.

name: Claydol
bio:
It appears to have been born from clay dolls
made by ancient people. It uses telekinesis to
float and move.

name: Croconaw
bio:
Once Croconaw has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will
absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are
forked back like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible
to remove when they have sunk in.

name: Hippowdon
bio:
Short-tempered and easily moved to violence. It whips up
whirlwinds of sand to crush its foes' spirits, then goes in for
the attack.

name: Greedent
bio:
Common throughout the Galar region, this
Pokémon has strong teeth and can chew
through the toughest of berry shells.

name: Skitty
bio:
Skitty is known to chase around playfully after its own tail.
In the wild, this Pokémon lives in holes in the trees of forests.
It is very popular as a pet because of its adorable looks.

name: Drilbur
bio:
It’s a digger, using its claws to burrow through the
ground. It causes damage to vegetable crops, so
many farmers have little love for it.

name: Dusclops
bio:
There are rumors that peeking inside its bandage-wrapped body
will cause one to get pulled in through the gaps between the
bandages, never to return. I've been too scared to verify.

name: Zorua
bio:
A once-departed soul, returned to life in Hisui. Derives power
from resentment, which rises as energy atop its head and takes
on the forms of foes. In this way, Zorua vents lingering malice.

name: Gothita
bio:
Even when nobody seems to be around, Gothita
can still be heard making a muted cry. Many believe
it’s speaking to something only it can see.

name: Skiploom
bio:
Skiploom’s flower blossoms when the temperature rises
above 64 degrees Fahrenheit. How much the flower opens
depends on the temperature. For that reason, this Pokémon
is sometimes used as a thermometer.

name: Palossand
bio:
This Pokémon lives on beaches, but it hates
water. Palossand can’t maintain its castle-like
shape if it gets drenched by a heavy rain.

name: Malamar
bio:
It’s said that Malamar’s hypnotic powers played
a role in certain history-changing events.

name: Wooper
bio:
When walking on land, it covers its body with a
poisonous film that keeps its skin from dehydrating.

name: Stufful
bio:
The way it protects itself by flailing its arms may
be an adorable sight, but stay well away. This is
flailing that can snap thick tree trunks.

name: Chien-Pao
bio: The hatred of those who perished by the sword long ago has clad itself in snow and become a Pokémon.

name: Abomasnow
bio:
A powerful Pokémon that can split huge boulders with ease.
Dislikes associating with others and chooses to live quietly deep
within the mountains, playing with the snow.

name: Burmy
bio:
If its cloak is even slightly damaged, Burmy will immediately
repair it with whatever is close at hand. The Pokémon within the
cloak is scrawny and vulnerable to the cold.

name: Fearow
bio:
A Pokémon that dates back many years. If it
senses danger, it flies high and away, instantly.

name: Porygon2
bio:
A bizarre item caused this Pokémon to evolve. While it now
exhibits many new gestures and expressions, its biology
remains inscrutable.

name: Clamperl
bio:
Clamperl’s pearls are exceedingly precious.
They can be more than 10 times as costly
as Shellder’s pearls.

name: Tapu Lele
bio:
Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is
devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and
can be described as nature incarnate.

name: Scizor
bio:
Evolved by way of a curious item. The shell covering its body
has been shown to be stronger than forged steel.

name: Mimikyu
bio:
There was a scientist who peeked under
Mimikyu’s old rag in the name of research.
The scientist died of a mysterious disease.

name: Primarina
bio:
For Primarina, every battle’s a stage. Its singing
and the dancing of its balloons will mesmerize
the audience.

name: Cosmoem
bio:
It sucks in dust from the air at an astounding rate,
frantically building up energy within its core as
preparation for evolution.

name: Blacephalon
bio:
A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it
causes explosions, then takes advantage of
opponents’ surprise to rob them of their vitality.

name: Haunter
bio:
This frightful, malevolent spirit can glide through walls,
appearing wherever it likes. According to rumor, victims of
a Haunter's lick will wither to death day by day.

name: Bellossom
bio:
Bellossom gather at times and appear to dance.
They say that the dance is a ritual to summon
the sun.

name: Mew
bio:
==Biology==
Mew is a pink, bipedal Pokémon with mammalian features. It has a rounded, wide snout; triangular ears; and large, blue eyes. It has short arms with three-fingered paws and large hind paws with oval markings on the soles. Its tail is long and thin with an ovoid tip. Its fur is so fine and thin, it can only be seen under a microscope.

Mew has shown a playful, childish personality, showing signs of high intelligence, curiosity, shyness, playfulness, and even selflessness. It is said to have the DNA of every single Pokémon contained within its body. This causes many scientists to theorize that Mew is the ancestor of all Pokémon. It is an incredibly adaptable species, capable of levitation and teleportation. It can use almost all known moves, regardless of their types. It has also shown the rare power to transform into all known Pokémon. It is capable of making itself invisible at will, so it entirely avoids notice even if it approaches people. As seen on several occasions, it has the ability to create an orb of energy around itself for protection, which can come in many colors, such as green, yellow, and pink.

According to journals found in Kanto's Pokémon Mansion, Mr. Fuji is the one who discovered Mew deep in the jungle and coined its name. With other scientists, he managed to gather some of Mew's DNA and used it in his mansion to create a modified clone of it, aiming it to be the most powerful Pokémon of all, which resulted in the birth of the Legendary Pokémon Mewtwo. Since Mew can make itself invisible, very few people have seen it, leading some scientists to declare it extinct and most to assume it to be nothing, but a mirage. However, sightings of it are still being reported to this day, confirming its existence. Even though it's rarely seen, it will willingly show itself to a person who is pure of heart and has a strong desire to see it.

According to the ''Pokémon the Series''-related radio drama, ''The Birth of Mewtwo'', Mew was discovered by Jessie's mother, Miyamoto, who registered its cry in a forest 20 years before the events of the series. It was worshiped for its protection by ancient people who created a song in its honor and believed it appeared once a year with the rising sun. It wasn't rediscovered until 18 years after Miyamoto met Mew by sunrise on the peak of a high mountain. As depicted in the episode ''In the Palms of our Hands!'' it is capable of splitting itself up and transforming into more than one Pokémon at the same time. It was also shown to possess a strong rivalry with its clone, Mewtwo in ''Mewtwo Strikes Back''.

Mew is the only known Pokémon capable of using the Z-Move Genesis Supernova.

name: Silvally
bio:
The final factor needed to release this
Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond
with a Trainer it trusts.

name: Herdier
bio:
The black fur that covers this Pokémon’s body
is dense and springy. Even sharp fangs bounce
right off.

name: Bouffalant
bio:
These Pokémon live in herds of about 20
individuals. Bouffalant that betray the herd will
lose the hair on their heads for some reason.

name: Combee
bio:
They swear fealty to a queen Pokémon and work diligently to
gather nectar. Each swarm produces a different flavor of honey.

name: Geodude
bio:
Makes its home in mountainous regions, using its arms to climb
along harsh mountain roads. Can be troublesome—carelessly
kicking one will cause it to fly into a rage and chase after you.

name: Rowlet
bio:
Flies noiselessly on delicate wings. It has mastered the art of
deftly launching dagger-sharp feathers from those same wings.

name: Unown
bio:
It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly
living creatures. I've pointed out that the species' many forms
resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

name: Glimmora
bio: Glimmora’s petals are made of crystallized poison energy. It has recently become evident that these petals resemble Tera Jewels.

name: Noibat
bio:
No wavelength of sound is beyond Noibat’s
ability to produce. The ultrasonic waves it
generates can overcome much larger Pokémon.

name: Ferrothorn
bio:
Its spikes are harder than steel. This Pokémon
crawls across rock walls by stabbing the spikes
on its feelers into the stone.

name: Fennekin
bio:
As it walks, it munches on a twig in place
of a snack. It intimidates opponents
by puffing hot air out of its ears.

name: Chikorita
bio:
In battle, Chikorita waves its leaf around to keep the foe at
bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf,
becalming the battling Pokémon and creating a cozy,
friendly atmosphere all around.

name: Pignite
bio:
When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow
sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

name: Krookodile
bio:
While terribly aggressive, Krookodile also has
the patience to stay hidden under sand for days,
lying in wait for prey.

name: Minior
bio:
Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable,
the shock of falling to the ground smashes the
shell to smithereens.

name: Heatran
bio:
Stories tell of this Pokémon being birthed from the boiling
magma within Mount Coronet. Its molten-steel body holds
many mysteries.

name: Ludicolo
bio:
If it hears festive music, it begins moving in
rhythm in order to amplify its power.

name: Kecleon
bio:
Its color changes for concealment and also
when its mood or health changes. The darker
the color, the healthier it is.

name: Woobat
bio:
It emits ultrasonic waves as it flutters about,
searching for its prey—bug Pokémon.

name: Manectric
bio:
It rarely appears before people. It is said to nest
where lightning has fallen.

name: Rattata
bio:
Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you
see one, you can be certain that 40 more
live in the area.

name: Joltik
bio:
Joltik latch on to other Pokémon and suck out
static electricity. They’re often found sticking to
Yamper’s hindquarters.

name: Regidrago
bio:
Its body is composed of crystallized dragon
energy. Regidrago is said to have the powers of
every dragon Pokémon.

name: Trevenant
bio:
Small roots that extend from the tips of this
Pokémon’s feet can tie into the trees of the
forest and give Trevenant control over them.

name: Scolipede
bio:
==Biology==
Scolipede is a plump, centipede-like Pokémon that usually stands with the front half of its body raised vertically off the ground. Its segmented body is dark magenta, except for its smooth, dark gray underside. Long, slightly bent horns similar to antennae extend from its head, as well as an identical pair of horns on its rear. Purple bands decorate these horns, and teardrop-shaped rings of the same color mark each body segment, one on each side of its body. It possesses four pairs of short, purple fore-claws on the body segments that make up its neck, which is used to inject poison. The four hind legs are longer, thicker, and spaced farther apart. Each hind limb has curved dark gray bands around the middle.

Scolipede lives in lush forests. It is very aggressive and will not give up until victorious. This Pokémon chases down enemies with great speed and then attacks relentlessly with its horns until it prevails. It latches onto the prey using the toxic spikes on its neck, and then slams it into the ground for the deadly poison effect. Similarly to its pre-Evolution, Whirlipede, it can curl up into a ball and roll towards its targets. Scolipede and Centiskorch can get into territorial fights, which end with the loser becoming the winner's prey.

name: Guzzlord
bio:
An unknown life-form called a UB. It may be
constantly hungry—it is certainly always
devouring something.

name: Skorupi
bio:
Its claws are not only razor-sharp but poisonous, making Skorupi
a highly dangerous Pokémon. It seems to be weakened by cold
temperatures, however.

name: Yanmega
bio:
Extremely violent. When hunting, it wastes none of its energy,
aiming only for prey's most vulnerable spots. Any who manage
to tame this Pokémon must be of incredible bravery.

name: Hydrapple
bio: These capricious syrpents have banded together. On the rare occasion that their moods align, their true power is unleashed.

name: Genesect
bio:
This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team
Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.

name: Seismitoad
bio:
This Pokémon is popular among the elderly,
who say the vibrations of its lumps are great
for massages.

name: Kubfu
bio:
If Kubfu pulls the long white hair on its head,
its fighting spirit heightens and power wells up
from the depths of its belly.

name: Magmar
bio:
Legend has it that this Pokémon was born from the crater of a
volcano. When wounded, it bathes in lava to heal its body, much
as one would soak in a hot spring.

name: Carnivine
bio:
Though this is a plant Pokémon, it has a gluttonous and unruly
temperament. Carnivine attacks its prey with its cavernous maw
wide open.

name: Voltorb
bio:
An enigmatic Pokémon that happens to bear a resemblance to a
Poké Ball. When excited, it discharges the electric current it has
stored in its belly, then lets out a great, uproarious laugh.

name: Iron Treads
bio: Sightings of this Pokémon have occurred in recent years. It resembles a mysterious object described in an old expedition journal.

name: Dragalge
bio:
Dragalge generates dragon energy by sticking
the plume on its head out above the ocean’s
surface and bathing it in sunlight.

name: Silcoon
bio:
Wraps itself in thin strings of silk while it stores energy for
evolution. It can't extend its limbs and its movement is slow,
but its eyes keep a sharp lookout—Silcoon is always on guard.

name: Gabite
bio:
Though Gabite are usually of a violent disposition, when I gave
one a glass bead it had been eyeing covetously, it suddenly
became quite docile.

name: Poliwag
bio:
In rivers with fast-flowing water, this Pokémon will
cling to a rock by using its thick lips, which act
like a suction cup.

name: Dusknoir
bio:
Comes to those whose lives have come to an end and escorts
their souls to the afterlife. Known to mistakenly take the souls of
those who yet have life left in them, albeit rarely.

name: Morelull
bio:
Morelull live in forests that stay dark even
during the day. They scatter flickering spores
that put enemies to sleep.

name: Aipom
bio:
This treetop dweller possesses a tail as dexterous as a hand.
Ancient writings describe this Pokémon as a one-armed oddity.

name: Brambleghast
bio: Brambleghast wanders around arid regions. On rare occasions, mass outbreaks of these Pokémon will bury an entire town.

name: Dragonite
bio:
This Pokémon is known as the Sea Incarnate.
Figureheads that resemble Dragonite decorate
the bows of many ships.

name: Carkol
bio:
By rapidly rolling its legs, it can travel at over
18 mph. The temperature of the flames it
breathes exceeds 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Wishiwashi
bio:
When it senses danger, its eyes tear up.
The sparkle of its tears signals other
Wishiwashi to gather.

name: Dragonair
bio:
This Pokémon gathers power in the orbs on its
tail and controls the weather. When enshrouded
by an aura, Dragonair has a mystical appearance.

name: Lugia
bio:
Lugia’s wings pack devastating power—a light fluttering of its
wings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this
Pokémon chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.

name: Avalugg
bio:
The armor of ice covering its lower jaw puts steel to shame and
can shatter rocks with ease. This Pokémon barrels along steep
mountain paths, cleaving through the deep snow.

name: Lotad
bio:
Its leaf grew too large for it to live on land.
That is how it began to live floating in the water.

name: Throh
bio:
They train in groups of five. Any member that
can’t keep up will discard its belt and leave
the group.

name: Hoppip
bio:
This Pokémon drifts and floats with the wind. If it senses the
approach of strong winds, Hoppip links its leaves with other
Hoppip to prepare against being blown away.

name: Squawkabilly
bio: Green-feathered flocks hold the most sway. When they’re out searching for food in the mornings and evenings, it gets very noisy.

name: Stonjourner
bio:
Once a year, on a specific date and at a specific
time, they gather out of nowhere and form up in
a circle.

name: Bisharp
bio:
Violent conflicts erupt between Bisharp and
Fraxure over places where sharpening stones
can be found.

name: Magby
bio:
This Pokémon lives in volcanic areas. With each breath, sparks
spurt from its mouth and nose. When Magby is in good health,
its flames gain a yellow tint.

name: Spewpa
bio:
The beaks of bird Pokémon can’t begin
to scratch its stalwart body.
To defend itself, it spews powder.

name: Hakamo-o
bio:
Before attacking its enemies, it clashes its
scales together and roars. Its sharp claws
shred the opposition.

name: Flareon
bio:
Flames burn within a saclike organ inside this Pokémon.
When Flareon inhales, these flames grow in intensity, reaching
a mighty 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Vikavolt
bio:
If it carries a Charjabug to use as a spare battery,
a flying Vikavolt can rapidly fire high-powered
beams of electricity.

name: Duraludon
bio:
The special metal that composes its body is very
light, so this Pokémon has considerable agility.
It lives in caves because it dislikes the rain.

name: Palkia
bio:
This Pokémon is feared as a deity in Hisuian legend. The birth
of Palkia was what caused the walls of our world to disappear,
creating a sky that spans for infinity.

name: Kyogre
bio:
Kyogre is said to be the personification of the sea itself.
Legends tell of its many clashes against Groudon,
as each sought to gain the power of nature.

name: Ekans
bio:
The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it
wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.

name: Spiritomb
bio:
It lays curses by thinking wicked thoughts. Writings tell that this
Pokémon was born out of the assembly of five score and eight
malevolent spirits.

name: Pansage
bio:
It’s good at finding berries and gathers them from
all over. It’s kind enough to share them
with friends.

name: Florges
bio:
Its life can span several hundred years. It’s said
to devote its entire life to protecting gardens.

name: Meowstic
bio:
The defensive instinct of the males is strong.
It’s when they’re protecting themselves or their
partners that they unleash their full power.

name: Skiddo
bio:
If it has sunshine and water, it doesn’t
need to eat, because it can generate
energy from the leaves on its back.

name: Weavile
bio:
This species corners prey as a pack, under the guidance of
a leader. Weavile displays increased cunning, leading me to
speculate that its evolution caused further brain development.

name: Tapu Bulu
bio:
It makes ringing sounds with its tail to let others
know where it is, avoiding unneeded conflicts.
This guardian deity of Ula’ula controls plants.

name: Stunfisk
bio:
For some reason, this Pokémon smiles slightly
when it emits a strong electric current from the
yellow markings on its body.

name: Roggenrola
bio:
==Biology==
Roggenrola is a roughly spherical rock-like Pokémon. Its body is blue and covered in large, smooth facets. It has a hexagonal, yellow artifice in the center of its body, leading to a hexagonal opening that functions as an ear. Roggenrola has a brown, rocky oblong atop its head and similar brown rocks that serve as feet.

Roggenrola is born deep underground and was discovered about 100 years ago in an earthquake fissure in a layer of exposed rock. Its steel-hard body is made up of dirt from many centuries ago and it compares its hard physique with those of Geodude and Carbink. However, a sufficiently long soak in water will cause its body to soften to some degree. Inside of Roggenrola lies an energy core, making its body somewhat warm to the touch. Its ear leads straight to its energy core, causing it to become angry if someone sticks their hand in there. As stated by Cilan in ''Where Did You Go, Audino?'', Roggenrola has sensitive hearing and can hear sounds that are inaudible to humans. It tends to follow the sounds it picks up with its lone ear, panicking if these sounds cease. Dwebble is a natural enemy of Roggenrola, as the former tends to think that Roggenrola is an inanimate rock to turn into a home. Similarly, Rhyperior has been known to mistake this Pokémon for an ordinary rock and fire them through their hands.

name: Hitmontop
bio:
After doing a handstand to throw off the
opponent’s timing, it presents its fancy kick moves.

name: Yamper
bio:
This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with
their work because it wants treats. As it runs,
it crackles with electricity.

name: Flabébé
bio:
Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it’s
collected from its flower. The crown has hidden
healing properties.

name: Grimer
bio:
Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid
to touch. Even weeds won’t grow in its path.

name: Toxtricity
bio:
This short-tempered and aggressive Pokémon
chugs stagnant water to absorb any toxins it
might contain.

name: Tangela
bio:
It is cloaked entirely in blue vines, preventing any glimpse of
its true identity. The vines impart a refreshing sensation when
chewed—they're useful as a spice.

name: Iron Valiant
bio: It’s possible that this is the object listed as Iron Valiant in a certain expedition journal.

name: Dunsparce
bio:
The nests Dunsparce live in are mazes of tunnels.
They never get lost in their own nests—they can
tell where they are by the scent of the dirt.

name: Tinkatuff
bio: These Pokémon make their homes in piles of scrap metal. They test the strength of each other’s hammers by smashing them together.

name: Toucannon
bio:
Known for forming harmonious couples, this
Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a
good luck charm.

name: Braviary
bio:
Screaming a bloodcurdling battle cry, this huge and ferocious
bird Pokémon goes out on the hunt. It blasts lakes with shock
waves, then scoops up any prey that float to the water's surface.

name: Omanyte
bio:
This Pokémon is a member of an ancient, extinct
species. Omanyte paddles through water with its
10 tentacles, looking like it’s just drifting along.

name: Grovyle
bio:
This Pokémon adeptly flies from branch to branch in trees.
In a forest, no Pokémon can ever hope to catch a fleeing
Grovyle however fast they may be.

name: Electabuzz
bio:
Feeds on electrical energy. During sudden showers beneath
looming thunderclouds, one can observe Electabuzz scaling tall
trees, where the Pokémon will then wait for lightning to strike.

name: Falinks
bio:
The six of them work together as one Pokémon.
Teamwork is also their battle strategy, and they
constantly change their formation as they fight.

name: Impidimp
bio:
It sneaks into people’s homes, stealing things
and feasting on the negative energy of the
frustrated occupants.

name: Wooloo
bio:
If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won’t be
able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this
Pokémon is surprisingly strong.

name: Mankey
bio:
An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers
easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.

name: Durant
bio:
With their large mandibles, these Pokémon can
crunch their way through rock. They work
together to protect their eggs from Sandaconda.

name: Lunatone
bio:
It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike
40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.

name: Hattrem
bio:
Using the braids on its head, it pummels foes to
get them to quiet down. One blow from those
braids would knock out a professional boxer.

name: Spheal
bio:
During the season when drift ice approaches the shore, Spheal
prefers living on the ice—where fewer predators lurk—rather
than the land. Its fur retains heat superbly and resists harsh cold.

name: Arrokuda
bio:
After it’s eaten its fill, its movements become
extremely sluggish. That’s when Cramorant
swallows it up.

name: Noivern
bio:
Flying through the darkness, it weakens enemies
with ultrasonic waves that could crush stone.
Its fangs finish the fight.

name: Munchlax
bio:
Its robust stomach allows it to nonchalantly devour even rotted
matter. It pays frequent visits to villages, seeking out food
scraps intended for compost.

name: Buizel
bio:
It moves freely in the water by spinning its forked tail for
propulsion. The resemblance to the screw of a steamboat
is coincidental.

name: Chansey
bio: This purehearted Pokémon shares its eggs with the injured.

name: Bastiodon
bio:
Its face is sturdy—as strong as diamond—and this hardness
offers a very stable defense. Much about this species is still
unknown, such as its natural habitat.

name: Inteleon
bio:
Its nictitating membranes let it pick out foes’
weak points so it can precisely blast them with
water that shoots from its fingertips at Mach 3.

name: Bruxish
bio:
Its skin is thick enough to fend off Mareanie’s
spikes. With its robust teeth, Bruxish crunches
up the spikes and eats them.

name: Klawf
bio: This Pokémon lives on sheer cliffs. It sidesteps opponents’ attacks, then lunges for their weak spots with its claws.

name: Lillipup
bio:
This Pokémon is far brighter than the average
child, and Lillipup won’t forget the love it
receives or any abuse it suffers.

name: Flygon
bio:
It is nicknamed the Desert Spirit because the
flapping of its wings sounds like a woman singing.

name: Eldegoss
bio:
The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be
spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar
regional specialty.

name: Dreepy
bio:
If this weak Pokémon is by itself, a mere child
could defeat it. But if Dreepy has friends to help
it train, it can evolve and become much stronger.

name: Golbat
bio:
It sinks its sharp fangs into other creatures and slurps up their
blood. A closer look at the fangs reveals that they are hollow
and akin to straws.

name: Luvdisc
bio:
Luvdisc makes its home in coral reefs in warm
seas. It especially likes sleeping in the space
between Corsola’s branches.

name: Tentacruel
bio:
It has 80 tentacles, each with a venomous tip. These tentacles
are also extendible, lengthening when Tentacruel attempts to
catch prey. Use caution.

name: Chatot
bio:
A versatile performer skilled in the imitation of human speech.
It is said that older, more experienced Chatot can even
understand the meaning of the words they mimic.

name: Octillery
bio:
While Octillery still shoots water from its mouth, the drastic
anatomical difference between it and Remoraid meant that for
a long time, no one believed the former evolved from the latter.

name: Purrloin
bio:
Opponents that get drawn in by its adorable
behavior come away with stinging scratches from
its claws and stinging pride from its laughter.

name: Maushold
bio: The larger pair protects the little ones during battles. When facing strong opponents, the whole group will join the fight.

name: Pheromosa
bio:
Although it’s alien to this world and a danger
here, it’s apparently a common organism in the
world where it normally lives.

name: Abra
bio:
Spends 18 hours of the day sleeping. Even while asleep, Abra
can control its psychic powers—should danger approach, the
Pokémon will simply teleport away.

name: Linoone
bio:
It uses its explosive speed and razor-sharp claws
to bring down prey. Running along winding
paths is not its strong suit.

name: Eevee
bio:
Harbors the potential to evolve into manifold forms.
Within Eevee lies the key to the mysteries of Pokémon
evolution—I'm certain of it.

name: Stantler
bio:
Its strangely shaped antlers have the power to bewitch those
who see them. Medicine made by grinding up the black orbs
from fallen antlers is an effective treatment for insomnia.

name: Mamoswine
bio:
This species reached its zenith during the period known as the
ice age. I suspect that Hisui's frigid climate is in harmony with
Mamoswine's constitution, thus awakening hidden potential.

name: Mesprit
bio:
Known as the Being of Emotion. In legend, this Pokémon was
feared, as any who showed disrespect would have their
emotions thrown into disarray.

name: Blaziken
bio:
Blaziken has incredibly strong legs—it can easily clear a
30-story building in one leap. This Pokémon’s blazing punches
leave its foes scorched and blackened.

name: Servine
bio:
When it gets dirty, its leaves can’t be used in
photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.

name: Vibrava
bio:
To help make its wings grow, it dissolves
quantities of prey in its digestive juices and
guzzles them down every day.

name: Drifloon
bio:
Said to lure away young children and carry them off to the
afterlife. Some whisper that Drifloon are formed of reincarnated
human souls, but these rumors are as yet unconfirmed.

name: Sylveon
bio:
It emits a soothing aura from its ribbon-shaped organs. It wraps
these appendages around quarrelers to instantly restore calm to
the situation.

name: Azelf
bio:
The dreaded Being of Willpower. Legends tell of this Pokémon
manipulating the will of its adversaries and turning them into
puppets of its own.

name: Kabuto
bio:
While some say this species has gone extinct,
Kabuto sightings are apparently fairly common
in some places.

name: Farigiraf
bio: The hardened head from the tail protects the head of the main body as Farigiraf whips its long neck around to headbutt enemies.

name: Smeargle
bio:
It draws symbols with the fluid that oozes from
the tip of its tail. Depending on the symbol,
Smeargle fanatics will pay big money for them.

name: Flaaffy
bio:
It stores electricity in its fluffy fleece. If it
stores up too much, it will start to go bald in
those patches.

name: Mareep
bio:
Rubbing its fleece generates electricity.
You’ll want to pet it because it’s cute, but if you
use your bare hand, you’ll get a painful shock.

name: Murkrow
bio:
Widely shunned as a bearer of ill fortune. Upon crossing paths
with this creature, I've been told one must chant ”Workrum,
Workrum—bad luck, don't come” as a protective incantation.

name: Hatterene
bio:
If you’re too loud around it, you risk being torn
apart by the claws on its tentacle. This Pokémon
is also known as the Forest Witch.

name: Granbull
bio:
Although it’s popular with young people,
Granbull is timid and sensitive, so it’s totally
incompetent as a watchdog.

name: Lechonk
bio: This Pokémon spurns all but the finest of foods. Its body gives off an herblike scent that bug Pokémon detest.

name: Wurmple
bio:
Likes sap and is abundant in the wild. Why it evolves into
various different forms is unknown. One cannot tell from a
Wurmple's appearance which form it will take when it evolves.

name: Poltchageist
bio: Poltchageist looks like a regional form of Sinistea, but it was recently discovered that the two Pokémon are entirely unrelated.

name: Eiscue
bio:
This Pokémon keeps its heat-sensitive head cool
with ice. It fishes for its food, dangling its single
hair into the sea to lure in prey.

name: Castform
bio:
Its form changes depending on the weather.
The rougher conditions get, the rougher
Castform’s disposition!

name: Pangoro
bio:
Using its leaf, Pangoro can predict the moves of
its opponents. It strikes with punches that can
turn a dump truck into scrap with just one hit.

name: Pinsir
bio:
This Pokémon clamps its pincers down on its prey
and then either splits the prey in half or flings
it away.

name: Moltres
bio:
There are stories of this Pokémon using its
radiant, flame-cloaked wings to light up paths
for those lost in the mountains.

name: Beheeyem
bio:
Sometimes found drifting above wheat fields,
this Pokémon can control the memories of
its opponents.

name: Spoink
bio:
Spoink keeps a pearl on top of its head. The pearl functions to
amplify this Pokémon’s psychokinetic powers. It is therefore on
a constant search for a bigger pearl.

name: Pupitar
bio:
It will not stay still, even while it’s a pupa.
It already has arms and legs under its solid shell.

name: Oricorio
bio:
This Oricorio has drunk red nectar. If its Trainer
gives the wrong order, this passionate Pokémon
becomes fiercely angry.

name: Lycanroc
bio:
With swift movements, this Pokémon gradually
backs its prey into a corner. Lycanroc’s fangs are
always aimed toward opponents’ weak spots.

name: Pincurchin
bio:
It stores electricity in each spine. Even if one gets
broken off, it still continues to emit electricity for
at least three hours.

name: Gardevoir
bio:
It will dedicate itself to defending a master it has come to
adore. Its pure white dress, reminiscent of those worn by ladies
of nobility, is the dress of one who is willing to risk their life.

name: Scatterbug
bio:
The powder that covers its body
regulates its temperature, so it
can live in any region or climate.

name: Zangoose
bio:
Zangoose usually stays on all fours, but when angered, it gets
up on its hind legs and extends its claws. This Pokémon shares
a bitter rivalry with Seviper that dates back over generations.

name: Ferroseed
bio:
Mossy caves are their preferred dwellings.
Enzymes contained in mosses help Ferroseed’s
spikes grow big and strong.

name: Sinistea
bio:
The teacup in which this Pokémon makes its
home is a famous piece of antique tableware.
Many forgeries are in circulation.

name: Zacian
bio:
This Pokémon has slumbered for many years.
Some say it’s Zamazenta’s elder sister—others
say the two Pokémon are rivals.

name: Wynaut
bio:
It tends to move in a pack with others.
They cluster in a tight group to sleep in a cave.

name: Bronzong
bio:
Some believe that its bell-like cry opens holes to another world.
It has been revered as a deity since ancient times.

name: Rampardos
bio:
Very little is known about its biology. Can knock down massive
trees by smashing its beautiful, pearl-like crown against them.

name: Cufant
bio:
If a job requires serious strength, this Pokémon
will excel at it. Its copper body tarnishes in the
rain, turning a vibrant green color.

name: Flapple
bio:
It flies on wings of apple skin and spits a
powerful acid. It can also change its shape
into that of an apple.

name: Audino
bio:
This Pokémon has a kind heart. By touching with
its feelers, Audino can gauge other creatures’
feelings and physical conditions.

name: Tyrogue
bio:
Even though it is small, it can’t be ignored because
it will slug any handy target without warning.

name: Garbodor
bio:
The toxic liquid it launches from its right arm
is so virulent that it can kill a weakened
creature instantly.

name: Vulpix
bio:
In its belly burns a fire, which Vulpix spits out in the form of
fireballs. When young, this Pokémon has but one white tail.
As the Pokémon matures, this single tail splits into six.

name: Floette
bio:
It gives its own power to flowers, pouring its
heart into caring for them. Floette never forgives
anyone who messes up a flower bed.

name: Shiftry
bio:
It lives quietly in the deep forest. It is said to
create chilly winter winds with the fans it holds.

name: Snivy
bio:
They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in
sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their
tails droop.

name: Gholdengo
bio: It has a sturdy body made up of stacked coins. Gholdengo overwhelms its enemies by firing coin after coin at them in quick succession.

name: Pawmo
bio: Pawmo uses a unique fighting technique in which it uses its forepaws to strike foes and zap them with electricity from its paw pads simultaneously.

name: Grookey
bio:
It attacks with rapid beats of its stick.
As it strikes with amazing speed, it gets
more and more pumped.

name: Absol
bio:
Because of this Pokémon’s ability to detect
danger, people mistook Absol as a bringer
of doom.

name: Whirlipede
bio:
==Biology==
Whirlipede is an insectoid Pokémon encased in a hard, segmented shell. It has two pairs of purple, horn-like feelers with dark gray stripes, with one pair extended upward from its front and the other pointing downward from its lower rear. Two poisonous barbs flank either side of each segment of its shell. The shell itself is purple, with red rings in the middle of each segment and a darker gray border circling its open center. Whirlipede's eyes can be seen within the center, and have slitted pupils, yellow sclerae, and thick, gray eyelids. 

Whirlipede remains motionless while storing energy for Evolution, but will move to stab approaching predators with its poisonous spikes. If attacked, it can quickly spin its body like a wheel and crash furiously into opponents. It can move to about the speed of 60 mph.

name: Ditto
bio:
When it encounters another Ditto, it will move
faster than normal to duplicate that opponent exactly.

name: Trumbeak
bio:
From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries
it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise
to new plants.

name: Glalie
bio:
It covers its body with an armor of ice harder than steel. Uses its
breath to freeze prey, which it then devours as if they were
frozen desserts.

name: Inkay
bio:
By exposing foes to the blinking of its
luminescent spots, Inkay demoralizes them,
and then it seizes the chance to flee.

name: Ting-Lu
bio: It slowly brings its exceedingly heavy head down upon the ground, splitting the earth open with huge fissures that run over 160 feet deep.

name: Tangrowth
bio:
Draped with long vines, it resembles a shrub in appearance.
It swings bundles of vines as though they were arms, wrapping
them around prey to ensnare them.

name: Rhyperior
bio:
This Pokémon evolved through use of a curious item. Its rocklike
hide is composed of a mysterious substance and can withstand a
blow from a masterwork sword with nary a scratch.

name: Coalossal
bio:
While it’s engaged in battle, its mountain of coal
will burn bright red, sending off sparks that
scorch the surrounding area.

name: Dratini
bio:
This Pokémon was long considered to be no
more than a myth. The small lump on a Dratini’s
forehead is actually a horn that’s still coming in.

name: Shelgon
bio:
Shelgon ignores its hunger entirely, never eating
any food. Apparently, Shelgon will evolve once
all its energy stores are used up.

name: Typhlosion
bio:
==Biology==
Typhlosion is a bulky mammalian Pokémon with a long, yet agile body. It is classified as a quadruped, but it is capable of bipedal movement. Most of its body is cream-colored, but its back and the top of its head are a dark green-blue. It has a short, rounded snout and small, triangular eyes and ears. When its mouth is open, its sharp canine teeth and thick tongue are visible. Each of its paws has five digits and there is a coarse, spiky fringe of fur along its rear. Across the back of its neck, several red spots can produce fire.

Typhlosion is capable of making anything go up in flames when angered and creating explosions by rubbing its fur together. The heat it generates when ready for battle creates a shimmering haze that can also be used to hide itself. When fully enraged, anything Typhlosion touches instantly goes up in flames. Though it is rare in the wild, it can be found living on grasslands. As mentioned in Sleep, Typhlosion is known to toss and turn while sleeping. Because this behavior causes its fur to rub together, creating accidental explosions, it is recommended to avoid a sleeping Typhlosion.

name: Chandelure
bio:
In homes illuminated by Chandelure instead of
lights, funerals were a constant occurrence—
or so it’s said.

name: Veluza
bio: Veluza has excellent regenerative capabilities. It sheds spare flesh from its body to boost its agility, then charges at its prey.

name: Applin
bio:
As soon as it’s born, it burrows into an apple. Not
only does the apple serve as its food source, but
the flavor of the fruit determines its evolution.

name: Feraligatr
bio:
Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth.
In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful
hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.

name: Registeel
bio:
It’s rumored that this Pokémon was born deep
underground in the planet’s mantle and that it
emerged onto the surface 10,000 years ago.

name: Marowak
bio:
When this Pokémon evolved, the skull of its
mother fused to it. Marowak’s temperament also
turned vicious at the same time.

name: Torterra
bio:
This remarkable, large-bodied Pokémon would serve beautifully
as borrowed scenery for a garden, and its strength is peerless.
Torterra roams the wilderness in search of clean water.

name: Sawk
bio:
The karate chops of a Sawk that’s trained itself
to the limit can cleave the ocean itself.

name: Polteageist
bio:
Leaving leftover black tea unattended is asking
for this Pokémon to come along and pour itself
into it, turning the tea into a new Polteageist.

name: Tsareena
bio:
A kick from the hardened tips of this Pokémon’s
legs leaves a wound in the opponent’s body and
soul that will never heal.

name: Relicanth
bio:
This Pokémon was discovered during deep-sea
exploration. Its appearance hasn’t changed in
100,000,000 years, so it’s called a living fossil.

name: Eelektross
bio:
They crawl out of the ocean using their arms.
They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag
it into the ocean.

name: Torkoal
bio:
You find abandoned coal mines full of them.
They dig tirelessly in search of coal.

name: Lumineon
bio:
Uses its gleaming fins to hunt its prey. The view of Lumineon
schooling near the surface of the sea at night is breathtaking—
it's as though there were shining stars right there.

name: Kartana
bio:
Although it’s alien to this world and a danger
here, it’s apparently a common organism in the
world where it normally lives.

name: Fraxure
bio:
Its skin is as hard as a suit of armor. Fraxure’s
favorite strategy is to tackle its opponents,
stabbing them with its tusks at the same time.

name: Lunala
bio:
It steals the light from its surroundings and then
becomes the full moon, showering its own light
across the night sky.

name: Spritzee
bio:
The scent its body gives off enraptures those
who smell it. Noble ladies had no shortage of
