love for Spritzee.

name: Shedinja
bio:
A strange Pokémon—it flies without moving its
wings, has a hollow shell for a body, and does
not breathe.

name: Spinda
bio:
Each Spinda’s spot pattern is different. With its
stumbling movements, it evades opponents’
attacks brilliantly!

name: Crocalor
bio: The valve in Crocalor’s flame sac is closely connected to its vocal cords. This Pokémon utters a guttural cry as it spews flames every which way.

name: Armaldo
bio:
Though it lives on land, it’s also a good swimmer.
It dives into the ocean in search of prey, using its
sharp claws to take down its quarry.

name: Bunnelby
bio:
It’s very sensitive to danger. The sound of
Corviknight’s flapping will have Bunnelby
digging a hole to hide underground in moments.

name: Maschiff
bio: Its well-developed jaw and fangs are strong enough to crunch through boulders, and its thick fat makes for an excellent defense.

name: Iron Thorns
bio: Some of its notable features match those of an object named within a certain expedition journal as Iron Thorns.

name: Diglett
bio:
It burrows through the ground at a shallow depth.
It leaves raised earth in its wake, making it easy
to spot.

name: Togetic
bio:
No records exist of Togetic being seen in the wilds. Rumors
abound that it evolves under the loving care of a trusted human
companion, upon whom the Pokémon then bestows great joy.

name: Sharpedo
bio:
This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sea.
Any ship entering the waters Sharpedo calls
home will be attacked—no exceptions.

name: Turtwig
bio:
This Pokémon becomes more energetic the more sunlight there
is. The part resembling a shell is similar to silt and is slightly
damp and warm to the touch.

name: Qwilfish
bio:
Fishers detest this troublesome Pokémon because it sprays
poison from its spines, getting it everywhere. A different form
of Qwilfish lives in other regions.

name: Goodra
bio:
Able to freely control the hardness of its metallic shell.
It loathes solitude and is extremely clingy—it will fume and
run riot if those dearest to it ever leave its side.

name: Camerupt
bio:
The humps on Camerupt’s back are formed by a transformation
of its bones. They sometimes blast out molten magma.
This Pokémon apparently erupts often when it is enraged.

name: Meowth
bio:
It washes its face regularly to keep the coin on
its forehead spotless. It doesn’t get along with
Galarian Meowth.

name: Latios
bio:
Latios will only open its heart to a Trainer with a
compassionate spirit. This Pokémon can fly faster than a
jet plane by folding its forelegs to minimize air resistance.

name: Walking Wake
bio: It resembles an illustration published in a paranormal magazine, said to be a depiction of a super-ancient Suicune.

name: Fomantis
bio:
During the day, Fomantis basks in sunlight and
sleeps peacefully. It wakes and moves around
at night.

name: Tepig
bio:
It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it
gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.

name: Wo-Chien
bio: It drains the life-force from vegetation, causing nearby forests to instantly wither and fields to turn barren.

name: Machoke
bio:
A sturdy creature boasting a robust physique and boundless
stamina. Loves training above all else and voluntarily assists with
tasks such as construction and clearing land.

name: Empoleon
bio:
Since ancient times, it has been revered by the people of Hisui,
who call it the Master of the Waves. Its wings are a match for
even master-crafted blades.

name: Pidove
bio:
It’s forgetful and not very bright, but many
Trainers love it anyway for its friendliness
and sincerity.

name: Copperajah
bio:
These Pokémon live in herds. Their trunks have
incredible grip strength, strong enough to crush
giant rocks into powder.

name: Decidueye
bio:
The air stored inside the rachises of Decidueye's feathers
insulates the Pokémon against Hisui's extreme cold. This is
firm proof that evolution can be influenced by environment.

name: Koffing
bio:
It adores polluted air. Some claim that Koffing
used to be more plentiful in the Galar region
than they are now.

name: Rellor
bio: It rolls its mud ball around while the energy it needs for evolution matures. Eventually the time comes for it to evolve.

name: Enamorus
bio:
When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter
comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémon's love
gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.

name: Cherubi
bio:
Once the fruit growing alongside the main body is large and
plump, Cherubi will use the nutrients within to evolve. The fruit
then detaches, becoming nourishment for other creatures.

name: Lopunny
bio:
Its fur is warm and yet remarkably light. This Pokémon kicks as
though it were a master of karate, driving back its opponents
with ease.

name: Gouging Fire
bio: It resembles an eerie Pokémon once shown in a paranormal magazine. That Pokémon was said to be an Entei regenerated from a fossil.

name: Politoed
bio:
The cry of a male is louder than that of a female.
Male Politoed with deep, menacing voices find
more popularity with the opposite gender.

name: Slurpuff
bio:
Slurpuff’s fur contains a lot of air, making it soft
to the touch and lighter than it looks.

name: Lickilicky
bio:
Its tongue can extend and contract freely, and it is capable of
reaching lengths over 10 times Lickilicky's height. Beware of the
saliva, as it contains corrosive elements.

name: Zubat
bio:
Makes its home in gloomy caves. Atrophied eyes have left this
Pokémon blind, so it scans its surroundings via sound waves that
it emits from its mouth as it flies.

name: Fezandipiti
bio: Fezandipiti beats its glossy wings to scatter pheromones that captivate people and Pokémon.

name: Raticate
bio:
Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers,
so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.

name: Kingler
bio:
Its oversized claw is very powerful, but when it’s
not in battle, the claw just gets in the way.

name: Patrat
bio:
Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on
the lookout, but it won’t notice a foe coming
from behind.

name: Munna
bio:
It eats dreams and releases mist. The mist is pink
when it’s eating a good dream, and black when
it’s eating a nightmare.

name: Slaking
bio:
Wherever Slaking live, rings of over a yard in diameter appear
in grassy fields. They are made by the Pokémon as it eats all
the grass within reach while lying prone on the ground.

name: Magearna
bio:
Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist,
the part called the Soul-Heart is the
actual life-form.

name: Snorunt
bio:
Arrives alongside the first snow. It's thought that homes Snorunt
visit will prosper for many generations. By tradition, one might
offer a lump of ice made from pure water at one's front door.

name: Sandaconda
bio:
Its unique style of coiling allows it to blast sand
out of its sand sac more efficiently.

name: Morgrem
bio:
With sly cunning, it tries to lure people into the
woods. Some believe it to have the power to
make crops grow.

name: Silicobra
bio:
It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy
is blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.

name: Ursaring
bio:
When the cold season arrives in Hisui, this Pokémon will wander
fields and mountains alike in search of its favorite berries.
Ursaring's hunger during this time makes it a ferocious danger.

name: Piplup
bio:
Prefers cold climes and appears along coasts. It's an adorable
little thing—as cute as any child—but it's also prideful, unwilling
to accept handouts from people.

name: Aggron
bio:
Long ago, there was a king who wore a helmet
meant to resemble the head of an Aggron. He
was trying to channel the Pokémon’s strength.

name: Hippopotas
bio:
Though large and languid, Hippopotas is difficult to detect
due to its tendency to burrow into and lurk beneath the soil.
When agitated or excited, it expels sand from its nostrils.

name: Okidogi
bio: Okidogi is a ruffian with a short temper. It can pulverize anything by swinging around the chain on its neck.

name: Metang
bio:
Using magnetic forces to stay aloft, this Pokémon
flies at high speeds, weaving through harsh
mountain terrain in pursuit of prey.

name: Aerodactyl
bio:
Aerodactyl’s sawlike fangs can shred skin to
tatters—even the skin of Steel-type Pokémon.

name: Necrozma
bio:
It needs light to survive, and it goes on a
rampage seeking it out. Its laser beams will
cut anything to pieces.

name: Teddiursa
bio:
It licks its paws because of the sweet honey that has soaked into
them. It is cunning, stealing into the nests of Combee and taking
for itself the honey that the Combee have amassed.

name: Cyclizar
bio: It can sprint at over 70 mph while carrying a human. The rider’s body heat warms Cyclizar’s back and lifts the Pokémon’s spirit.

name: Mismagius
bio:
The incantations Mismagius chants can ward against misfortune,
so a custom exists of inviting it into one's home. Incur the
Pokémon's displeasure, however, and disaster will surely ensue.

name: Toxapex
bio:
Within the poison sac in its body is a poison so
toxic that Pokémon as large as Wailord will still
be suffering three days after it first takes effect.

name: Snubbull
bio:
In contrast to its appearance, it’s quite
timid. When playing with other puppy
Pokémon, it sometimes gets bullied.

name: Kangaskhan
bio:
There are records of a lost human child being
raised by a childless Kangaskhan.

name: Golduck
bio:
Its body is strong, and it has webbing on its hands and feet.
Golduck can swim easily through rough seas, clawing its way
through the high waves.

name: Vanillish
bio:
It blasts enemies with cold air reaching −148
degrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it
spares their lives afterward—it’s a kind Pokémon.

name: Sobble
bio:
When it gets wet, its skin changes color,
and this Pokémon becomes invisible as if
it were camouflaged.

name: Orbeetle
bio:
It emits psychic energy to observe and study
what’s around it—and what’s around it can
include things over six miles away.

name: Appletun
bio:
Its body is covered in sweet nectar, and the
skin on its back is especially yummy. Children
used to have it as a snack.

name: Gulpin
bio:
Most of Gulpin’s body is made up of its stomach—its heart and
brain are very small in comparison. This Pokémon’s stomach
contains special enzymes that dissolve anything.

name: Scraggy
bio:
It protects itself with its durable skin. It’s thought
that this Pokémon will evolve once its skin has
completely stretched out.

name: Ogerpon
bio: This mischief-loving Pokémon is full of curiosity. It battles by drawing out the type-based energy contained within its masks.

name: Gastly
bio:
Gaseous and completely impalpable. Also highly dangerous—
inhaling part of its poisonous body will cause one to
faint instantly.

name: Nymble
bio: It’s highly skilled at a fighting style in which it uses its jumping capabilities to dodge incoming attacks while also dealing damage to opponents.

name: Sandile
bio:
Sandile is small, but its legs and lower body are
powerful. Pushing sand aside as it goes, Sandile
moves through the desert as if it’s swimming.

name: Weedle
bio:
Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides
in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.

name: Wormadam
bio:
When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of
this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.

name: Kadabra
bio:
There are rumors that a child with mystical powers became
a Kadabra; however, this remains unverified. I suspect that
the spoon Kadabra holds enhances its brain waves.

name: Gothorita
bio:
On nights when the stars shine, this Pokémon’s
psychic power is at its strongest. It’s unknown just
what link Gothorita has to the greater universe.

name: Meltan
bio:
They live as a group, but when the time comes,
one strong Meltan will absorb all the others
and evolve.

name: Dwebble
bio:
It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there
are no suitable rocks to be found, Dwebble may
move in to the ports of a Hippowdon.

name: Sprigatito
bio: The sweet scent its body gives off mesmerizes those around it. The scent grows stronger when this Pokémon is in the sun.

name: Heracross
bio:
This Pokémon has an unparalleled horn. Heracross itself
demonstrates tremendous power—it's capable of throwing
several people trained in the traditional arts of war at once.

name: Parasect
bio:
Mushroom-lacking specimens of this Pokémon lie unmoving in
the forest, lending credence to the hypothesis that the large
mushroom is in control of Parasect's actions.

name: Poliwrath
bio:
Poliwrath is skilled at both swimming and martial
arts. It uses its well-trained arms to dish out
powerful punches.

name: Glimmet
bio: Glimmet’s toxic mineral crystals look just like flower petals. This Pokémon scatters poisonous powder like pollen to protect itself.

name: Gigalith
bio:
==Biology==
Gigalith is a blue, quadrupedal Pokémon, with various spiny, reddish-orange, crystalline features jutting out from all over its body; two appear along its back, one on its chest, and one topping each of its four feet. Each foot also bears two claws of a similar appearance and is connected to the body by gray joints. The yellow, front-facing ears of its previous evolutionary relatives are now filled in with red and appear to have become full-fledged eyes. Several of the aforementioned reddish-orange crystals also appear on its face; three below its eyes, one in the middle resembling a crest, and two other crystals connected to the sides of its head. The stone comprising its body is extremely hard.

Gigalith compresses energy in the core inside its body, allowing it to fire attacks powerful enough to blow away mountains. When it fires these attacks at full power, the sheer force of the blast creates multiple cracks on its body. It can also store sunlight in its orange crystals, magnify it within its body, and shoot powerful energy balls that can destroy dump trucks from its mouth, though it loses this ability at night or during rain. It lives in caves and tunnels deep underground. Gigalith is a hardy Pokémon with impressive horsepower, and is a popular partner for construction workers and miners. In Galar, it works with Copperajah in construction sites and mines.

name: Greavard
bio: This friendly Pokémon doesn’t like being alone. Pay it even the slightest bit of attention, and it will follow you forever.

name: Dodrio
bio:
One of Doduo’s two heads splits to form
a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph
in prairies.

name: Meowscarada
bio: With skillful misdirection, it rigs foes with pollen-packed flower bombs. Meowscarada sets off the bombs before its foes realize what’s going on.

name: Umbreon
bio:
It is most active in the wee hours of the night, when moonlight
bathes the land. Its large eyes can pierce the darkness and
perceive prey with absolute clarity.

name: Popplio
bio:
If Popplio want to create big, powerful balloons,
they must be persistent. It takes daily practice for
these Pokémon to develop their skills.

name: Carbink
bio:
It’s said that somewhere in the world, there’s
a mineral vein housing a large pack of slumbering
Carbink. It’s also said that this pack has a queen.

name: Ninetales
bio:
The coat of gleaming golden fur is quite magnificent.
This species is said to store sacred power in its nine long tails
and to live for a millennium.

name: Yanma
bio:
Its frail wings are so thin that one can see clear through them.
However, during flight these wings exhibit the power to churn
air with force enough to launch a house skyward.

name: Luxray
bio:
They form packs, each having one male as leader. Legends say
that when Luxray's two eyes shimmer with gold, the Pokémon
can see through anything.

name: Skuntank
bio:
Sprays a poisonous fluid to take down prey. Sometimes, unable
to stomach the stench of its own fluid, it leaves the bested
prey uneaten.

name: Crabominable
bio:
Before it stops to think, it just starts pummeling.
There are records of its turning back
avalanches with a flurry of punches.

name: Gloom
bio:
What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey.
It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

name: Taillow
bio:
Taillow is young—it has only just left its nest. As a result,
it sometimes becomes lonesome and cries at night.
This Pokémon feeds on Wurmple that live in forests.

name: Maractus
bio:
Once each year, this Pokémon scatters its seeds.
They’re jam-packed with nutrients, making them
a precious food source out in the desert.

name: Wiglett
bio: Though it looks like Diglett, Wiglett is an entirely different species. The resemblance seems to be a coincidental result of environmental adaptation.

name: Accelgor
bio:
Discarding its shell made it nimble. To keep
itself from dehydrating, it wraps its body in
bands of membrane.

name: Stunky
bio:
The poison that gushes from its aft end is accompanied by an
utterly evil-smelling odor with such potency that one whiff can
induce memory loss.

name: Garganacl
bio: Many Pokémon gather around Garganacl, hoping to lick at its mineral-rich salt.

name: Slowking
bio:
Slowking can solve any problem presented to it,
but no one can understand a thing Slowking says.

name: Dragapult
bio:
Apparently the Dreepy inside Dragapult’s
horns eagerly look forward to being launched out
at Mach speeds.

name: Ceruledge
bio: An old set of armor steeped in grudges caused this Pokémon’s evolution. Ceruledge cuts its enemies to pieces without mercy.

name: Charcadet
bio: Its firepower increases when it fights, reaching over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. It likes berries that are rich in fat.

name: Sandslash
bio:
It climbs trees by hooking on with its sharp claws.
Sandslash shares the berries it gathers, dropping
them down to Sandshrew waiting below the tree.

name: Larvitar
bio:
It feeds on soil. After it has eaten a large
mountain, it will fall asleep so it can grow.

name: Marshadow
bio:
This Pokémon can conceal itself in any shadow,
so it went undiscovered for a long time.

name: Sceptile
bio:
Sceptile has seeds growing on its back. They are said to be
bursting with nutrients that revitalize trees. This Pokémon
raises the trees in a forest with loving care.

name: Espurr
bio:
There’s enough psychic power in Espurr to send a
wrestler flying, but because this power can’t be
controlled, Espurr finds it troublesome.

name: Drowzee
bio:
If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes
show you dreams it had eaten in the past.

name: Comfey
bio:
These Pokémon smell very nice. All Comfey wear
different flowers, so each of these Pokémon has
its own individual scent.

name: Exploud
bio:
This Pokémon can do more than just shout. To
communicate with others of its kind, it’ll emit all
sorts of sounds from the holes in its body.

name: Emboar
bio:
It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves.
It grows a beard of fire.

name: Donphan
bio:
If Donphan were to tackle with its hard body, even a house
could be destroyed. Using its massive strength, the Pokémon
helps clear rock and mud slides that block mountain trails.

name: Drakloak
bio:
Without a Dreepy to place on its head and
care for, it gets so uneasy it’ll try to substitute
any Pokémon it finds for the missing Dreepy.

name: Magnemite
bio:
A bizarre Pokémon with but a single eye embedded in an iron
sphere. I suspect this creature levitates due to the magnetism it
emits from its arms, which resemble horseshoe-shaped magnets.

name: Altaria
bio:
This Pokémon has a kind disposition, but if it’s
provoked, it will threaten opponents with shrill
cries before attacking them without mercy.

name: Hypno
bio:
Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will
try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.

name: Victreebel
bio:
Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey.
Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day,
bones and all.

name: Hitmonchan
bio:
Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to
need a short break after fighting for three minutes.

name: Rhyhorn
bio:
Ludicrously strong—when it butts heads with a mountain, it is
the mountain that shatters. But its short legs struggle with turns,
and it is incapable of stopping unless it collides with something.
